plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial flowering plant known for its beautiful white to pinkish flowers that bloom in winter, often around Christmas time in temperate climates. It is native to mountainous regions of Central and Southern Europe.
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, the Christmas Rose is not a true rose; its flowers are prized for blooming in deep winter, sometimes through snow.

plants.name: Cleistocactus winteri
plants.description: A cactus species that produces vibrant red-orange tubular flowers during the cooler months, adapted to Andean high-altitude environments.
plants.funFact: This cactus's striking flowers attract hummingbirds that serve as its primary pollinators during the Andes' dry, cool season.

plants.name: Leucadendron 'Safari Sunset'

plants.funFact: Leucadendrons are dioecious, meaning male and female flowers grow on separate plants, a rarity among flowering shrubs.

plants.name: Acacia baileyana
plants.description: An Australian native tree known for its profuse display of bright yellow pom-pom flowers blooming in late autumn and early winter, providing vital nectar for pollinators.
plants.bloomingSeason: May to August in Australia (Southern Hemisphere winter), locally blooming anywhere depending on climate
